text: Junior Lee Coffey (March 21, 1942 - August 30, 2021) was an American professional football player. He was a running back in the National Football League. He played with the Green Bay Packers, Atlanta Falcons, and New York Giants. His career lasted from 1965 until 1971. He was born in Kyle, Texas. Coffey died on August 30, 2021 in Auburn, Washington from heart failure at the age of 79.Former NFL RB, college star Junior Coffey dies at 79 ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Green Bay Packers players Category:Atlanta Falcons players Category:New York Giants players Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:American football running backs Category:Sportspeople from Texas
title: Junior Coffey
